alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 11:42PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 1130 PM MDT... At 1041 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along extending from near Wolf Creek Housing to 9 miles south of Gordon. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Hoover Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Rock Hill, Bayonne and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 99 and 132. Highway 61 between mile markers 210 and 215. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
